amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for the Meals on Wheels program by $5 million and reduces funding for the Food and Drug Administration by $5.5 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 18 in the Congressional Record of July 17, 1997, to increase the appropriation in the bill for Meals on Wheels by $5 million. The increase in funding would be offset by reducing salaries and expenses within the FDA by $5.5 million.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Sanders amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.
